FIM100.name: Decision-making in the Agri-Food System
FIM100.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FIM100.description: Organization and operation of the agri-food system. Economic analysis of agri-food firms and consumers. Management functions and decision-making of agri-food firms.

FIM203.name: Data Analysis for the Agri-Food System
FIM203.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FIM203.description: Introduction to data analysis tools used in the management of food systems.
FIM203.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Agribusiness Management Major or in the Agribusiness Management Minor or in the Environmental Economics Minor or in the Environmental Economics and Management major or in the Food Industry Management Major or in the Food Industry Management Minor.

FIM210.name: Professional Seminar in Food Industry Management
FIM210.description: Industry trends in food industry management. Verbal, written, and visual communication techniques applied to professional situations, including professional development and career planning.
FIM210.restrictions: Open to students in the Food Industry Management Major or in the Food Industry Management Minor.

FIM220.name: Food Product Marketing
FIM220.description: Structure of the food marketing system including food processors, manufacturers, retailers and food service. Impact of consumer behavior and buying patterns. International food product marketing. Strategic planning in food marketing.

FIM222.name: Agribusiness and Food Industry Sales
FIM222.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FIM222.description: Selling processes and activities within agribusiness and food firms. Principles and techniques of sales. Operation of sales organizations.
FIM222.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors.

FIM224.name: Information and Market Intelligence in the Agri-Food Industry
FIM224.description: Researching agri-food issues, food industry business environments, and agri-food industry trends. Information gathering. Electronic library reference sources. Synthesis of data and information into market intelligence.

FIM260.name: World Food, Population and Poverty
FIM260.description: Description and analysis of world food, population and poverty problems. Interrelationships between developed and developing countries.

FIM303.name: Economics of Decision Making in the Agri-Food System
FIM303.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FIM303.description: Managerial economics with applications focusing on agriculture, food, and resources issues.
FIM303.prerequisite: (MTH 124 and EC 201 and EC 202 and ABM 203) and (STT 200 or STT 201 or STT 315)

FIM335.name: Food Marketing Management
FIM335.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FIM335.description: Management decision-making in food industry organizations (processors, wholesalers, retailers). Marketing and sales in response to customer and consumer needs. Distribution and merchandising systems in domestic and international contexts.

FIM351.name: Retail Management
FIM351.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FIM351.description: Domestic and international retailing structure, environment, and development. Managerial strategy. Locational, purchasing, organizational, personnel and promotional techniques. Retail budgeting and control. Social and ethical considerations.
FIM351.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the Food Industry Management major and open to students in the Food Industry Management Specialization.

FIM400.name: Public Policy Issues in the Agri-Food System
FIM400.description: Objectives, alternatives and consequences of public policy in the agri-food system. Analysis of economic implications for food and agribusiness firms, farmers, consumers and society.

FIM405.name: Corporate Environmental Management (W)
FIM405.description: Integration of environmental protection and pollution prevention with business management. Economic and strategic analysis of environmental protection.
FIM405.prerequisite: (EEM 255) and (ACC 201 or ACC 230 or ABM 130) and ABM 203 and (((ABM 303 or EC 301) or approval of department) and completion of Tier I writing requirement)

FIM410.name: Advanced Professional Seminar in Food Industry Management
FIM410.description: Advanced professional problems and reestablishment of career planning in the agri-food system. Industry trends, career alternatives, and job search strategies. Enhanced verbal, written, and visual communication techniques.
FIM410.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Food Industry Management Minor or in the Food Industry Management Major.

FIM415.name: Human Resource Management: Changes and Challenges
FIM415.description: Human resource management strategies used in food industries. Changing demographics and labor force issues. Diversity, labor markets, regulations, employer policies, job analysis and staffing, compensation and benefits, motivation, performance appraisal, food labor unions, and cases.

FIM422.name: Vertical Coordination in the Agri-Food System
FIM422.description: Analysis of vertical coordination in the industrialized agri-food system. Agricultural cooperatives, contracts, marketing orders, and trade associations. Analysis of imperfect competition and methods of conducting business. Interaction with legal systems and government.

FIM427.name: Global Agri-Food Industries and Markets
FIM427.description: Strategic understanding of the international agri-food system. Analysis of global production, marketing, and consumption. Knowledge of changing conditions in international industries and markets. Global trends and opportunities.
FIM427.prerequisite: (FIM 220 or ABM 225) and (EC 201 and EC 202) and ABM 203

FIM439.name: Strategic Management for Food and Agribusiness Firms (W)
FIM439.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FIM439.description: Principles and techniques for analyzing and implementing business and strategy. Approaches to identify and manage strategic problems. Application to firms in the food and agribusiness industries. Capstone project.
FIM439.prerequisite: (FIM 220) and (ABM 130 or ABM 435 or FI 320 or ABM 303 or EC 301 or approval of department)

FIM460.name: Retail Information Systems
FIM460.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FIM460.description: Information needed to make effective retail decisions. Use of technology in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting retail systems data and in writing and presenting reports.

FIM490.name: Independent Study in Food Industry Management
FIM490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FIM490.description: Independent supervised study in topics in food industry management.
FIM490.restrictions: Not open to freshmen. Approval of department; application required. Students are limited to a combined total of 6 credits in ABM 490 and FIM 490.

FIM493.name: Professional Internship in Food Industry Management
FIM493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FIM493.description: Supervised professional experience in the food industry.
FIM493.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Food Industry Management major. Approval of department; application required. A student may earn a maximum of 6 credits in all enrollments for any or all of these courses
